219 /* Negative test configuration structure */
220 typedef struct retryNegativeTest
221 {
222  /* Type of corruption
223  0 - No corruption
224  1 - Checksum corruption
225  2 - CRC corruption */
226  uint16_t corruptType;
227  /* Event to corrupt
228  0 - Command
229  1 - Response
230  2 - Async Event */
231  uint16_t corruptEvent;
232 }retryNegativeTest_t;

274 static void MmwaveLink_mboxCallbackFxn (Mbox_Handle handle, Mailbox_Type remoteEndpoint)
275 {
276  /* Indicate to the Radar Link that a message has been received. */
277  g_MailboxInterruptFunc(0, NULL);
278 }

291 static rlComIfHdl_t MmwaveLink_mboxOpen(rlUInt8_t deviceIndex, uint32_t flags)
292 {
293  Mailbox_Config cfg;
294  int32_t errCode;
295 
296  /* Initialize the mailbox configuration: */
297  if(Mailbox_Config_init(&cfg) < 0)
298  {
299  System_printf("Error: Unable to initialize mailbox configuration\n");
300  return NULL;
301  }
302 
303  cfg.writeMode = MAILBOX_MODE_POLLING;
304  cfg.readMode = MAILBOX_MODE_CALLBACK;
305  cfg.readCallback = MmwaveLink_mboxCallbackFxn;
306 
307  /* Open the Mailbox to the BSS */
308  gMmwaveLinkMCB.bssMailbox = Mailbox_open(MAILBOX_TYPE_BSS, &cfg, &errCode);
309  if (gMmwaveLinkMCB.bssMailbox == NULL)
310  {
311  System_printf("Error: Unable to open the Mailbox Instance [Error code %d]\n", errCode);
312  return NULL;
313  }
314 
315  return gMmwaveLinkMCB.bssMailbox;
316 }
317 
329 static int32_t MmwaveLink_mboxClose(rlComIfHdl_t fd)
330 {
331  int32_t errCode;
332 
333  /* Close the Mailbox */
334  errCode = Mailbox_close ((Mbox_Handle)fd);
335  if (errCode < 0)
336  System_printf ("Error: Unable to close the BSS Mailbox [Error code %d]\n", errCode);
337 
338  return errCode;
339 }
340 
352 static int32_t MmwaveLink_mboxRead(rlComIfHdl_t fd, uint8_t* pBuff, uint16_t len)
353 {
354  int32_t status;
355 
356  status = Mailbox_read((Mbox_Handle)fd, pBuff, len);
357 
358  if (retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptType == 1)
359  {
360  if (retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptEvent == 1)
361  {
362  hit_count++;
363  if (hit_count == 2)
364  {
365  pBuff[10] = ~(pBuff[14]);
366  pBuff[11] = ~(pBuff[15]);
367  retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptType = 0;
368  hit_count = 0;
369  }
370  }
371  }
372  if (retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptType == 1)
373  {
374  if (retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptEvent == 2)
375  {
376  hit_count++;
377  if (hit_count == 5)
378  {
379  pBuff[10] = ~(pBuff[14]);
380  pBuff[11] = ~(pBuff[15]);
381  retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptType = 0;
382  hit_count = 0;
383  }
384  }
385  }
386 
387  return status;
388 }
389 
401 static int32_t MmwaveLink_mboxWrite(rlComIfHdl_t fd, uint8_t* pBuff, uint16_t len)
402 {
403  int32_t status;
404  /*
405  Currently, the mmwavelink can not detect the error condition where it did not receive a mailbox layer ACK from BSS.
406 
407  For instance:
408  - The mmwavelink may try to send a message before an ACK was received for the previous message.
409  - The mmwavelink may try to resend a message that did not receive a mmwavelink layer ACK back from BSS. It is possible that the
410  message did not receive a mailbox layer ACK as well from BSS.
411 
412  In either case, Mailbox_writeReset() has to be called before another message is sent to BSS.
413 
414  The mmwavelink has no hooks to call the Mailbox_writeReset().
415  Therefore, a write reset is done if it is detected that a mailbox layer ACK was not received for the
416  previous message (MAILBOX_ETXFULL).
417  */
418  if (retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptType == 1)
419  {
420  if (retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptEvent == 0)
421  {
422  hit_count++;
423  if (hit_count == 1)
424  {
425  pBuff[14] = ~(pBuff[14]);
426  pBuff[15] = ~(pBuff[15]);
427  retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptType = 0;
428  hit_count = 0;
429  }
430  }
431  }
432  status = Mailbox_write((Mbox_Handle)fd, pBuff, len);
433  if(status == MAILBOX_ETXFULL)
434  {
435  Mailbox_writeReset((Mbox_Handle)fd);
436  status = Mailbox_write((Mbox_Handle)fd, pBuff, len);
437  }
438 
439  return status;
440 }

520 static void MmwaveLink_transferCompletionCallbackFxn(uintptr_t arg, uint8_t transferCompletionCode)
521 {
522  /* set the TAG to indicate eDMA data transfer is done */
523  eDMADataTransferDone++;
524 }

526 /* initialize eDMA module */
527 int32_t MmwaveLink_initEDMA(uint8_t instance)
528 {
529  int32_t retVal = 0;
530 
531  retVal = EDMA_init(instance);
532  if (retVal != EDMA_NO_ERROR)
533  {
534  System_printf ("Debug: EDMA instance %d initialization returned error %d\n", instance, retVal);
535  return -1;
536  }
537  System_printf ("Debug: EDMA instance %d has been initialized\n", instance);
538  return 0;
539 }
540 
553 static EDMA_Handle MmwaveLink_openEDMA(uint8_t instance)
554 {
555  EDMA_errorInfo_t EDMAErrorInfo;
556  EDMA_transferControllerErrorInfo_t EDMATransferControllerErrorInfo;
557  EDMA_Handle edmaHndle = NULL;
558  EDMA_instanceInfo_t instanceInfo;
559  int32_t retVal = 0;
560 
561  memset(&EDMAErrorInfo, 0, sizeof(EDMAErrorInfo));
562  memset(&EDMATransferControllerErrorInfo, 0, sizeof(EDMATransferControllerErrorInfo));
563 
564  /* Open the EDMA Instance */
565  edmaHndle = EDMA_open(instance, &retVal, &instanceInfo);
566  if (edmaHndle == NULL)
567  {
568  System_printf("Error: Unable to open the edma Instance(%d), errorCode = %d\n",instance, retVal);
569  return NULL;
570  }
571 
572  return edmaHndle;
573 }
574 
575 /* configure eDMA channel to copy CQ data to L3 memory */
576 int32_t MmwaveLink_ConfigEdma(EDMA_Handle handle, uint8_t chId,
577  uint32_t* pSrcAddress, uint32_t * pDestAddress,
578  uint16_t aCount, uint16_t bCount, uint16_t cCount,
579  uint16_t linkChId)
580 {
581  EDMA_channelConfig_t config;
582  int32_t errorCode = EDMA_NO_ERROR;
583 
584  config.channelId = chId;
585  config.channelType = (uint8_t)EDMA3_CHANNEL_TYPE_DMA;
586  config.paramId = chId;
587  config.eventQueueId = 0;
588 
589  config.paramSetConfig.sourceAddress = (uint32_t) pSrcAddress;
590  config.paramSetConfig.destinationAddress = (uint32_t) pDestAddress;
591 
592  config.paramSetConfig.aCount = aCount;
593  config.paramSetConfig.bCount = bCount;
594  config.paramSetConfig.cCount = cCount;
595  config.paramSetConfig.bCountReload = config.paramSetConfig.bCount;
596 
597  config.paramSetConfig.sourceBindex = 0;
598  config.paramSetConfig.destinationBindex = 0;
599 
600  config.paramSetConfig.sourceCindex = 0;
601  config.paramSetConfig.destinationCindex = 0;
602 
603  config.paramSetConfig.linkAddress = EDMA_NULL_LINK_ADDRESS;
604  config.paramSetConfig.transferType = (uint8_t)EDMA3_SYNC_A;
605  config.paramSetConfig.transferCompletionCode = 0;
606  config.paramSetConfig.sourceAddressingMode = (uint8_t) EDMA3_ADDRESSING_MODE_LINEAR;
607  config.paramSetConfig.destinationAddressingMode = (uint8_t) EDMA3_ADDRESSING_MODE_LINEAR;
608 
609  /* don't care because of linear addressing modes above */
610  config.paramSetConfig.fifoWidth = (uint8_t) EDMA3_FIFO_WIDTH_8BIT;
611 
612  config.paramSetConfig.isStaticSet = false;
613  config.paramSetConfig.isEarlyCompletion = false;
614  config.paramSetConfig.isFinalTransferInterruptEnabled = true;
615  config.paramSetConfig.isIntermediateTransferInterruptEnabled = false;
616  config.paramSetConfig.isFinalChainingEnabled = false;
617  config.paramSetConfig.isIntermediateChainingEnabled = false;
618  config.transferCompletionCallbackFxn = MmwaveLink_transferCompletionCallbackFxn;
619 
620  if ((errorCode = EDMA_configChannel(handle, &config, true)) != EDMA_NO_ERROR)
621  {
622  System_printf("Error: EDMA_configChannel() failed with error code = %d\n", errorCode);
623  }
624  return(errorCode);
625 }
626 
627 /* Trigger eDMA transfer */
628 void MmwaveLink_triggerEdmaTransfer()
629 {
630  EDMA_startDmaTransfer(EdmaHandle, EDMA_CHANNEL_CQ_DATA);
631 }
632 
633 /* intialize and configure eDMA to copy CQ Data to L3 memory */
634 int MmwaveLink_CQedmaSetup(void)
635 {
636 
637  MmwaveLink_initEDMA(0);
638  EdmaHandle = MmwaveLink_openEDMA(0);
639  if(EdmaHandle == NULL)
640  {
641  System_printf("Error: MmwaveLink_CQedmaSetup() MmwaveLink_openEDMA failed with null handle.\n");
642  return -1;
643  }
644  /* Configure eDMA */
645  MmwaveLink_ConfigEdma(EdmaHandle, EDMA_CHANNEL_CQ_DATA,
646  (uint32_t *)CQ1_RAM_ADDRESS,
647  (uint32_t *)L3_MEM_ADDRESS,
648  0x1000, 1, 1, EDMA_NUM_DMA_CHANNELS);
649  EDMA3EnableTransfer(EDMA_CC0_BASE_ADDRESS, EDMA_CHANNEL_CQ_DATA, EDMA3_TRIG_MODE_EVENT);
650  return 0;
651 }

653 
654 volatile int8_t cqTestStatus = -10;
655 volatile int8_t cpTestStatus = -10;
656 
669 int8_t MmwaveLink_VerifyCQData(uint8_t coreType, uint8_t deviceType)
670 {
671  unsigned char numSlices, i, maxByteLoc;
672  volatile unsigned char *cq1MemLoc;
673  volatile unsigned char *cq2MemLoc;
674  uint32_t cqBaseAddr14xx = *(uint32_t*)(MSS_14xx_CQ_CFG_REG_ADDRESS);
675  if (coreType == RL_PLATFORM_MSS)
676  {
677  if(deviceType == RL_AR_DEVICETYPE_14XX)
678  {
679  /* for 14xx test not transfering CQ data reading from CQ memory directly */
680  cq1MemLoc = (unsigned char*) ((((cqBaseAddr14xx & 0x007F0000U) >> 16U)*0x10) + MSS_14xx_CHIRP_INFO_REG_ADDRESS);
681  cq2MemLoc = (unsigned char*) ((((cqBaseAddr14xx & 0x7F000000U) >> 24U)*0x10) + MSS_14xx_CHIRP_INFO_REG_ADDRESS);
682  }
683  else if (deviceType == RL_AR_DEVICETYPE_16XX)
684  {
685  cq1MemLoc = (unsigned char*) (MSS_16xx_TEST_CQ1_L3_MEM_ADDRESS);
686  cq2MemLoc = (unsigned char*) (MSS_16xx_TEST_CQ2_L3_MEM_ADDRESS);
687  }
688  else
689  {
690  cq1MemLoc = (unsigned char*) (MSS_18xx_TEST_CQ1_L3_MEM_ADDRESS);
691  cq2MemLoc = (unsigned char*) (MSS_18xx_TEST_CQ2_L3_MEM_ADDRESS);
692  }
693  }
694  else
695  {
696  if (deviceType == RL_AR_DEVICETYPE_16XX)
697  {
698  cq1MemLoc = (unsigned char*) (DSS_16xx_TEST_CQ1_L3_MEM_ADDRESS);
699  cq2MemLoc = (unsigned char*) (DSS_16xx_TEST_CQ2_L3_MEM_ADDRESS);
700  }
701  else
702  {
703  cq1MemLoc = (unsigned char*) (DSS_18xx_TEST_CQ1_L3_MEM_ADDRESS);
704  cq2MemLoc = (unsigned char*) (DSS_18xx_TEST_CQ2_L3_MEM_ADDRESS);
705  }
706  }
707 
708  /* CQ data will be available in CQ RAM which is a ping-pong memory when the CQ monitors are
709  enabled. Currently supported CQ monitors are RL_RF_RX_SATURATION_MON_CONF_SB for CQ2 and
710  RL_RF_RX_SIGIMG_MON_CONF_SB for CQ1. CQ data will be refreshed every chirp by the hardware.
711  User has to ensure that before the next chirp finishes, the current chirps CQ data is either
712  processed or transferred to a local memory for further processing.
713  */
714 
715  /* check for timeSlice value for CQ1 and CQ2 as configured to device via
716  rlRfRxIfSatMonConfig and rlRfRxSigImgMonConfig API */
717  if (CQ_NUM_SLICES != cq1MemLoc[0])
718  {
719  cqTestStatus = -1;
720  }
721  else
722  {
723  numSlices = cq1MemLoc[0];
724  /* get max byte location which application needs to
725  read starting from numSlice in CQ1-RAM memory */
726  maxByteLoc = (4*(numSlices+1)/2);
727  for (i = 2; i < maxByteLoc; i+=2)
728  {
729  /* check if any signal band data is less than image band data for all
730  primary and secondary slices, then set error */
731  if (((cq1MemLoc[i] / 2) * -1) < ((cq1MemLoc[i+1] /2)*-1))
732  {
733  cqTestStatus = -2;
734  break;
735  }
736  }
737 
738  /* if conditions are not matched for all slices then set success */
739  if (i == maxByteLoc)
740  {
741  cqTestStatus = 0;
742  }
743 
744  }
745 
746  if (CQ_NUM_SLICES != cq2MemLoc[0])
747  {
748  cqTestStatus = -1;
749  }
750  else
751  {
752  numSlices = cq2MemLoc[0];
753  for (i = 1; i < numSlices; i++)
754  {
755  /* check if any signal band data is less than image band data for all
756  primary and secondary slices, then set error */
757  if (cq2MemLoc[i] != 0)
758  {
759  cqTestStatus = -2;
760  break;
761  }
762  }
763 
764  /* if conditions are not matched for all slices then set success */
765  if (i == maxByteLoc)
766  {
767  cqTestStatus = 0;
768  }
769 
770  }
771  return cqTestStatus;
772 }
773 
800 int8_t MmwaveLink_VerifyCPData(uint8_t coreType)
801 {
802  uint8_t cp0DataBuff[16] = {0};
803  volatile uint16_t chirpNum, channelNum, profileId;
804 
805  if (coreType == RL_PLATFORM_MSS)
806  {
807  /* copy CP0 data to local buffer */
808  memcpy((void*)&cp0DataBuff[0], (void*)0x52070020U, 16U);
809  }
810  else
811  {
812  /* copy CP0 data to local buffer */
813  memcpy((void*)&cp0DataBuff[0], (void*)0x21070020U, 16U);
814  }
815 
816  /* Please refer mmWaveLink or ICD for Chirp parameter (CP) information fields */
817  chirpNum = (((cp0DataBuff[3] & 0x0F)<< 8) | (cp0DataBuff[2]));
818  channelNum = (cp0DataBuff[0] & 0x03);
819  profileId = ((cp0DataBuff[0] >> 2) & 0x0F);
820  /* verify CP-0 data for channel 0 */
821  if ((channelNum != 0U) || (profileId != chirpCfg[0].profileId) || \
822  ((chirpNum + 1) != ((frameCfg.chirpEndIdx - frameCfg.chirpStartIdx + 1) * frameCfg.numLoops)))
823  {
824  cpTestStatus = -1;
825  }
826  else
827  {
828  cpTestStatus = 0;
829  }
830 
831  chirpNum = (((cp0DataBuff[7] & 0x0F)<< 8) | (cp0DataBuff[6]));
832  channelNum = (cp0DataBuff[4] & 0x03);
833  profileId = ((cp0DataBuff[4] >> 2) & 0x0F);
834  /* verify CP-0 data for channel 1 */
835  if ((channelNum != 1U) || (profileId != chirpCfg[0].profileId) || \
836  ((chirpNum + 1) != ((frameCfg.chirpEndIdx - frameCfg.chirpStartIdx + 1) * frameCfg.numLoops)))
837  {
838  cpTestStatus -=1;
839  }
840  else
841  {
842  cpTestStatus = 0;
843  }
844 
845  return cpTestStatus;
846 }
847 
848 
859 static void MmwaveLink_asyncEventHandler(uint8_t devIndex, uint16_t sbId, uint16_t sbLen, uint8_t *payload)
860 {
861  uint16_t asyncSB = RL_GET_SBID_FROM_UNIQ_SBID(sbId);
862  uint16_t msgId = RL_GET_MSGID_FROM_SBID(sbId);
863 
864  /* Process the received message: */
865  switch (msgId)
866  {
867  case RL_RF_ASYNC_EVENT_MSG:
868  {
869  /* Received Asychronous Message: */
870  switch (asyncSB)
871  {
872  case RL_RF_AE_CPUFAULT_SB:
873  {
874  rlCpuFault_t* rfCpuFault = (rlCpuFault_t*)payload;
875  System_printf ("Debug: CPU Fault has been detected\n");
876  System_printf ("Debug: Fault \n type: %d, lineNum: %d, LR: 0x%x \n"
877  "PrevLR: 0x%x, spsr: 0x%x, sp: 0x%x, PC: 0x%x \n"
878  "Status: 0x%x, Source: %d, AxiErrType: %d, AccType: %d, Recovery Type: %d \n",
879  rfCpuFault->faultType,
880  rfCpuFault->lineNum,
881  rfCpuFault->faultLR,
882  rfCpuFault->faultPrevLR,
883  rfCpuFault->faultSpsr,
884  rfCpuFault->faultSp,
885  rfCpuFault->faultAddr,
886  rfCpuFault->faultErrStatus,
887  rfCpuFault->faultErrSrc,
888  rfCpuFault->faultAxiErrType,
889  rfCpuFault->faultAccType,
890  rfCpuFault->faultRecovType);
891  break;
892  }
893  case RL_RF_AE_ESMFAULT_SB:
894  {
895  System_printf ("Debug: ESM Fault. Group1:[0x%x] Group2:[0x%x]\n",
896  ((rlBssEsmFault_t*)payload)->esmGrp1Err, ((rlBssEsmFault_t*)payload)->esmGrp2Err);
897  break;
898  }
899  case RL_RF_AE_INITCALIBSTATUS_SB:
900  {
901  gInitTimeCalibStatus = ((rlRfInitComplete_t*)payload)->calibStatus;
902  if(gInitTimeCalibStatus != 0U)
903  {
904  System_printf ("Debug: Init time calibration status [0x%x] \n", gInitTimeCalibStatus);
905  }
906  else
907  {
908  System_printf ("Error: All Init time calibrations Failed:\n");
909  }
910  break;
911  }
912  case RL_RF_AE_FRAME_TRIGGER_RDY_SB:
913  {
914  gFrameStartStatus = 1U;
915  break;
916  }
917  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TIMING_FAIL_REPORT_SB:
918  {
919  monTestPassFlag = false;
920  System_printf ("Debug: RL_RF_AE_MON_TIMING_FAIL_REPORT_SB received. timingFailCode=0x%x \n",
921  ((rlCalMonTimingErrorReportData_t*)payload)->timingFailCode);
922  break;
923  }
924  case RL_RF_AE_RUN_TIME_CALIB_REPORT_SB:
925  {
926  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.calibRunTimeRep, payload, sizeof(rlRfRunTimeCalibReport_t));
927  MmwaveLink_verifyRunTimeCalibRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.calibRunTimeRep);
928  break;
929  }
930  case RL_RF_AE_MON_DIG_PERIODIC_REPORT_SB:
931  {
932  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monDigPeriodicRep, payload, sizeof(rlDigPeriodicReportData_t));
933  MmwaveLink_verifyDigPeriodicRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monDigPeriodicRep);
934  break;
935  }
936  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TEMPERATURE_REPORT_SB:
937  {
938  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTempReport, payload, sizeof(rlMonTempReportData_t));
939  MmwaveLink_verifyTemperatureRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTempReport);
940  break;
941  }
942  case RL_RF_AE_MON_RX_GAIN_PHASE_REPORT:
943  {
944  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monRxGainPhRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonRxGainPhRep_t));
945  MmwaveLink_verifyRxGainPhRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monRxGainPhRep);
946  break;
947  }
948  case RL_RF_AE_MON_RX_NOISE_FIG_REPORT:
949  {
950  /* stop updating the global cached value after first error so that we can dump the first failed case valus */
951  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monNoiseFigRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonRxNoiseFigRep_t));
952  MmwaveLink_verifyRxNoiseFigRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monNoiseFigRep);
953  break;
954  }
955  case RL_RF_AE_MON_RX_IF_STAGE_REPORT:
956  {
957  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monRxIfStageRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonRxIfStageRep_t));
958  MmwaveLink_verifyRxIfStageRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monRxIfStageRep);
959  break;
960  }
961  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TX0_POWER_REPORT:
962  {
963  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx0powRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonTxPowRep_t));
964  MmwaveLink_verifyTxPower(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx0powRep, MMWAVELINK_TEST_MON_TX0_POWER);
965  break;
966  }
967  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TX1_POWER_REPORT:
968  {
969  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx1powRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonTxPowRep_t));
970  MmwaveLink_verifyTxPower(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx1powRep, MMWAVELINK_TEST_MON_TX1_POWER);
971  break;
972  }
973  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TX2_POWER_REPORT:
974  {
975  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx2powRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonTxPowRep_t));
976  MmwaveLink_verifyTxPower(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx2powRep, MMWAVELINK_TEST_MON_TX2_POWER);
977  break;
978  }
979  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TX0_BALLBREAK_REPORT:
980  {
981  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx0BallbreakRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonTxBallBreakRep_t));
982  MmwaveLink_verifyTxBallBreak(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx0BallbreakRep, MMWAVELINK_TEST_MON_TX0_BALL_BRK);
983  break;
984  }
985  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TX1_BALLBREAK_REPORT:
986  {
987  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx1BallbreakRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonTxBallBreakRep_t));
988  MmwaveLink_verifyTxBallBreak(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx1BallbreakRep, MMWAVELINK_TEST_MON_TX1_BALL_BRK);
989  break;
990  }
991  case RL_RF_AE_MON_REPORT_HEADER_SB:
992  {
993  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monRepHeader, payload, sizeof(rlMonReportHdrData_t));
994  MmwaveLink_verifyRepHeader(&gMonDataAeStrct.monRepHeader);
995  break;
996  }
997  case RL_RF_AE_GPADC_MEAS_DATA_SB:
998  {
999  isGetGpAdcMeasData = 1U;
1000  memcpy(&rcvGpAdcData, payload, sizeof(rlRecvdGpAdcData_t));
1001  break;
1002  }
1003  case RL_RF_AE_DIG_LATENTFAULT_REPORT_SB:
1004  {
1005  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monDigLatFaultRep, payload, sizeof(rlDigLatentFaultReportData_t));
1006  MmwaveLink_verifyDigLatFaultRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monDigLatFaultRep);
1007  break;
1008  }
1009  case RL_RF_AE_FRAME_END_SB:
1010  {
1011  gFrameStartStatus = 0U;
1012  Semaphore_post (gSensorStopSem);
1013  System_printf ("Debug: Frame Stop Async Event \n");
1014  break;
1015  }
1016  case RL_RF_AE_ANALOG_FAULT_SB:
1017  {
1018  System_printf ("Debug: Analog Fault Async Event \n");
1019  break;
1020  }
1021  default:
1022  {
1023  System_printf ("Error: Asynchronous Event SB Id %d not handled with msg ID [0x%x] \n", asyncSB,msgId);
1024  break;
1025  }
1026  }
1027  break;
1028  }
1029  case RL_RF_ASYNC_EVENT_1_MSG:
1030  {
1031  switch (asyncSB)
1032  {
1033  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TX2_BALLBREAK_REPORT:
1034  {
1035  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx2BallbreakRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonTxBallBreakRep_t));
1036  MmwaveLink_verifyTxBallBreak(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx2BallbreakRep, MMWAVELINK_TEST_MON_TX2_BALL_BRK);
1037  break;
1038  }
1039  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TX_GAIN_MISMATCH_REPORT:
1040  {
1041  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTxGainPhMisMatchRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonTxGainPhaMisRep_t));
1042  MmwaveLink_verifyTxGainPhaseRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTxGainPhMisMatchRep);
1043  break;
1044  }
1045  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TX0_BPM_REPORT:
1046  {
1047  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx0BpmRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonTxBpmRep_t));
1048  MmwaveLink_verifyTxBpm(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx0BpmRep, MMWAVELINK_TEST_MON_TX0_BPM);
1049  break;
1050  }
1051  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TX1_BPM_REPORT:
1052  {
1053  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx1BpmRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonTxBpmRep_t));
1054  MmwaveLink_verifyTxBpm(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx1BpmRep, MMWAVELINK_TEST_MON_TX1_BPM);
1055  break;
1056  }
1057  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TX2_BPM_REPORT:
1058  {
1059  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx2BpmRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonTxBpmRep_t));
1060  MmwaveLink_verifyTxBpm(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx2BpmRep, MMWAVELINK_TEST_MON_TX2_BPM);
1061  break;
1062  }
1063  case RL_RF_AE_MON_SYNTHESIZER_FREQ_REPORT:
1064  {
1065  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monSynthFreqRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonSynthFreqRep_t));
1066  MmwaveLink_verifyRfSynthFreqRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monSynthFreqRep);
1067  break;
1068  }
1069  case RL_RF_AE_MON_EXT_ANALOG_SIG_REPORT:
1070  {
1071  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monExtAnaSigRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonExtAnaSigRep_t));
1072  MmwaveLink_verifyExtAnalogSigRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monExtAnaSigRep);
1073  break;
1074  }
1075  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TX0_INT_ANA_SIG_REPORT:
1076  {
1077  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx0IntAnaSigRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonTxIntAnaSigRep_t));
1078  MmwaveLink_verifyRfTxIntAnaSignals(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx0IntAnaSigRep, MMWAVELINK_TEST_MON_TX0_INT_ANA_SIG);
1079  break;
1080  }
1081  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TX1_INT_ANA_SIG_REPORT:
1082  {
1083  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx1IntAnaSigRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonTxIntAnaSigRep_t));
1084  MmwaveLink_verifyRfTxIntAnaSignals(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx1IntAnaSigRep, MMWAVELINK_TEST_MON_TX1_INT_ANA_SIG);
1085  break;
1086  }
1087  case RL_RF_AE_MON_TX2_INT_ANA_SIG_REPORT:
1088  {
1089  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx2IntAnaSigRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonTxIntAnaSigRep_t));
1090  MmwaveLink_verifyRfTxIntAnaSignals(&gMonDataAeStrct.monTx2IntAnaSigRep, MMWAVELINK_TEST_MON_TX2_INT_ANA_SIG);
1091  break;
1092  }
1093  case RL_RF_AE_MON_RX_INT_ANALOG_SIG_REPORT:
1094  {
1095  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monRxIntAnaSigRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonRxIntAnaSigRep_t));
1096  MmwaveLink_verifyRxIntAnaSigRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monRxIntAnaSigRep);
1097  break;
1098  }
1099  case RL_RF_AE_MON_PMCLKLO_INT_ANA_SIG_REPORT:
1100  {
1101  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monPmClkIntAnaSigRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonPmclkloIntAnaSigRep_t));
1102  MmwaveLink_verifyIntPmClkLoSigRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monPmClkIntAnaSigRep);
1103  break;
1104  }
1105  case RL_RF_AE_MON_GPADC_INT_ANA_SIG_REPORT:
1106  {
1107  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monGpadcIntAnaSigRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonGpadcIntAnaSigRep_t));
1108  MmwaveLink_verifyIntGpadcSigRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monGpadcIntAnaSigRep);
1109  break;
1110  }
1111  case RL_RF_AE_MON_PLL_CONTROL_VOLT_REPORT:
1112  {
1113  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monPllConvVoltRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonPllConVoltRep_t));
1114  MmwaveLink_verifyPllControlRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monPllConvVoltRep);
1115  break;
1116  }
1117  case RL_RF_AE_MON_DCC_CLK_FREQ_REPORT:
1118  {
1119  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monDccClkFreqRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonDccClkFreqRep_t));
1120  MmwaveLink_verifyDccClockFreqRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monDccClkFreqRep);
1121  break;
1122  }
1123  case RL_RF_AE_MON_RX_MIXER_IN_PWR_REPORT:
1124  {
1125  memcpy(&gMonDataAeStrct.monRxMixrInPwrRep, payload, sizeof(rlMonRxMixrInPwrRep_t));
1126  MmwaveLink_verifyRxMixInpPowerRep(&gMonDataAeStrct.monRxMixrInPwrRep);
1127  break;
1128  }
1129  default:
1130  {
1131  System_printf ("Error: Asynchronous Event SB Id %d not handled with msg ID 0x%x\n", asyncSB,msgId);
1132  break;
1133  }
1134  }
1135  break;
1136  }
1137  /* Async Event from MMWL */
1138  case RL_MMWL_ASYNC_EVENT_MSG:
1139  {
1140  switch (asyncSB)
1141  {
1142  case RL_MMWL_AE_MISMATCH_REPORT:
1143  {
1144  int errTemp = *(int32_t*)payload;
1145  /* CRC mismatched in the received Async-Event msg */
1146  if (errTemp == RL_RET_CODE_CRC_FAILED)
1147  {
1148  gMmwlCrcFailAsyncEvent = 1U;
1149  }
1150  /* Checksum mismatched in the received msg */
1151  else if (errTemp == RL_RET_CODE_CHKSUM_FAILED)
1152  {
1153  gMmwlChecksumFailAsyncEvent = 1U;
1154  }
1155  /* Polling to HostIRQ is timed out,
1156  i.e. Device didn't respond to CNYS from the Host */
1157  else if (errTemp == RL_RET_CODE_HOSTIRQ_TIMEOUT)
1158  {
1159  printf("HostIRQ polling timed out \n");
1160  }
1161  else
1162  {
1163  printf("mmWaveLink error \n");
1164  }
1165  break;
1166  }
1167  case RL_MMWL_AE_INTERNALERR_REPORT:
1168  {
1169  System_printf("Error: RL_MMWL_AE_INTERNALERR_REPORT received\n");
1170  break;
1171  }
1172  }
1173  }
1174  default:
1175  {
1176  System_printf ("Error: Asynchronous message %d is NOT handled\n", msgId);
1177  break;
1178  }
1179  }
1180  return;
1181 }
1182 
1194 static rlInt32_t MmwaveLink_spawn (RL_P_OSI_SPAWN_ENTRY pEntry, const void* pValue, uint32_t flags)
1195 {
1196  /* Record the function which is to be spawned. */
1197  if (gMmwaveLinkMCB.spawnFxn != NULL)
1198  gMmwaveLinkMCB.spawnOverrun++;
1199 
1200  /* Record the entry to be spawned. */
1201  gMmwaveLinkMCB.spawnFxn = pEntry;
1202 
1203  /* Post the semaphore and wake up the link management task */
1204  Semaphore_post (gMmwaveLinkMCB.linkSemaphore);
1205  return 0;
1206 }
1207 
1218 static rlInt32_t MmwaveLink_computeCRC(rlUInt8_t* data, rlUInt32_t dataLen, rlUInt8_t crcType, rlUInt8_t* crc)
1219 {
1220  CRC_SigGenCfg signGenCfg;
1221  int32_t errCode;
1222  uint64_t signature;
1223  uint32_t index;
1224  uint8_t* ptrSignature;
1225  uint8_t crcLength;
1226 
1227  /* Initialize the signature generation configuration */
1228  memset ((void *)&signGenCfg, 0, sizeof(CRC_SigGenCfg));
1229 
1230  /* Allocate a unique transaction id: */
1231  if (CRC_getTransactionId (gMmwaveLinkMCB.crcHandle, &signGenCfg.transactionId, &errCode) < 0)
1232  {
1233  System_printf ("Error: CRC Driver Get transaction id failed [Error code %d]\n", errCode);
1234  return -1;
1235  }
1236 
1237  /* Populate the signature generation configuration: */
1238  signGenCfg.ptrData = (uint8_t*)data;
1239  signGenCfg.dataLen = dataLen;
1240 
1241  /* Compute the signature for the specific data on Channel-1 */
1242  if (CRC_computeSignature (gMmwaveLinkMCB.crcHandle, &signGenCfg, &errCode) < 0)
1243  {
1244  System_printf ("Error: CRC Driver compute signature failed [Error code %d]\n", errCode);
1245  return -1;
1246  }
1247 
1248  /* Get the Signature for Channel */
1249  if (CRC_getSignature (gMmwaveLinkMCB.crcHandle, signGenCfg.transactionId, &signature, &errCode) < 0)
1250  {
1251  System_printf ("Error: CRC Driver get signature failed [Error code %d]\n", errCode);
1252  return -1;
1253  }
1254 
1255  /* Get the pointer to the CRC Signature: */
1256  ptrSignature = (uint8_t*)&signature;
1257 
1258  /* Determine the length of the CRC: */
1259  switch (crcType)
1260  {
1261  case RL_CRC_TYPE_16BIT_CCITT:
1262  {
1263  crcLength = 2;
1264  break;
1265  }
1266  case RL_CRC_TYPE_32BIT:
1267  {
1268  crcLength = 4;
1269  break;
1270  }
1271  case RL_CRC_TYPE_64BIT_ISO:
1272  {
1273  crcLength = 8;
1274  break;
1275  }
1276  default:
1277  {
1278  System_printf ("Error: Unknown CRC Type passed from mmWave Link: %d\n", crcType);
1279  return -1;
1280  }
1281  }
1282 
1283  /* Copy the CRC signature into CRC output array */
1284  for(index = 0U; index < crcLength; index++)
1285  {
1286  *(crc + index) = *(ptrSignature + index);
1287  }
1288  if (retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptType == 2)
1289  {
1290  if (retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptEvent == 0)
1291  {
1292  hit_count++;
1293  if (hit_count == 1)
1294  {
1295  *(crc + 0) = ~(*(crc + 0));
1296  hit_count = 0;
1297  retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptType = 0;
1298  }
1299  }
1300  if (retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptEvent == 1)
1301  {
1302  hit_count++;
1303  if (hit_count == 2)
1304  {
1305  *(crc + 0) = ~(*(crc + 0));
1306  hit_count = 0;
1307  retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptType = 0;
1308  }
1309  }
1310  if (retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptEvent == 2)
1311  {
1312  hit_count++;
1313  if (hit_count == 3)
1314  {
1315  *(crc + 0) = ~(*(crc + 0));
1316  hit_count = 0;
1317  retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptType = 0;
1318  }
1319  }
1320  }
1321 
1322  return 0;
1323 }
1324 
1334 static void MmwaveLink_mmwaveLinkMgmtTask (UArg arg0, UArg arg1)
1335 {
1336  RL_P_OSI_SPAWN_ENTRY spawnFxn;
1337  uintptr_t key;
1338  Semaphore_Params semParams;
1339 
1340  /* Initialize the mmWave Link Semaphore: */
1341  Semaphore_Params_init(&semParams);
1342  semParams.mode = Semaphore_Mode_BINARY;
1343  gMmwaveLinkMCB.linkSemaphore = Semaphore_create(0, &semParams, NULL);
1344 
1345  /* Execute forever: */
1346  while (1)
1347  {
1348  /* Pending on the link semaphore */
1349  Semaphore_pend (gMmwaveLinkMCB.linkSemaphore, BIOS_WAIT_FOREVER);
1350 
1351  /* Critical Section: We record the spawn function which is to be executed */
1352  key = Hwi_disable();
1353  spawnFxn = gMmwaveLinkMCB.spawnFxn;
1354  gMmwaveLinkMCB.spawnFxn = NULL;
1355  Hwi_restore (key);
1356 
1357  /* Execute the spawn function: */
1358  spawnFxn (NULL);
1359  }
1360 }
1361 
1362 
1374 int32_t MmwaveLink_getVersion (void)
1375 {
1376  rlVersion_t verArgs;
1377  int32_t retVal;
1378  /* currently patch binaries are available for AWR16 ES2.0 & IWR16 ES2.0 only*/
1379  int8_t rfPatchBuildVer, rfPatchDebugVer;
1380 
1381  /* Get the version string: */
1382  retVal = rlDeviceGetVersion(RL_DEVICE_MAP_INTERNAL_BSS, &verArgs);
1383  if (retVal != 0)
1384  {
1385  System_printf ("Error: Unable to get the device version from mmWave link [Error %d]\n", retVal);
1386  return -1;
1387  }
1388 
1389  /* Display the version information */
1390  System_printf ("RF H/W Version : %02d.%02d\n",
1391  verArgs.rf.hwMajor, verArgs.rf.hwMinor);
1392  System_printf ("RF F/W Version : %02d.%02d.%02d.%02d.%02d.%02d.%02d\n",
1393  verArgs.rf.fwMajor, verArgs.rf.fwMinor, verArgs.rf.fwBuild, verArgs.rf.fwDebug,
1394  verArgs.rf.fwYear, verArgs.rf.fwMonth, verArgs.rf.fwDay);
1395  rfPatchDebugVer = ((verArgs.rf.patchBuildDebug) & 0x0F);
1396  rfPatchBuildVer = (((verArgs.rf.patchBuildDebug) & 0xF0) >> 4);
1397 
1398  System_printf ("RF F/W Patch Version : %02d.%02d.%02d.%02d.%02d.%02d.%02d\n",
1399  verArgs.rf.patchMajor, verArgs.rf.patchMinor, rfPatchBuildVer, rfPatchDebugVer,
1400  verArgs.rf.patchYear, verArgs.rf.patchMonth, verArgs.rf.patchDay);
1401  System_printf ("mmWaveLink Version: %02d.%02d.%02d.%02d\n",
1402  verArgs.mmWaveLink.major, verArgs.mmWaveLink.minor,
1403  verArgs.mmWaveLink.build, verArgs.mmWaveLink.debug);
1404  return 0;
1405 }
1406 
1417 int32_t MmwaveLink_initLink (rlUInt8_t deviceType, rlUInt8_t platform)
1418 {
1419  Task_Params taskParams;
1420  CRC_Config crcCfg;
1421  rlClientCbs_t RlApp_ClientCtx;
1422  int32_t errCode;
1423 
1424  /* Initialize and populate the Mmwave Link MCB */
1425  memset ((void*)&gMmwaveLinkMCB, 0, sizeof(MmwaveLink_MCB));
1426 
1427  /*****************************************************************************
1428  * Start CRC driver:
1429  *****************************************************************************/
1430 
1431  /* Setup the default configuration: */
1432  CRC_initConfigParams(&crcCfg);
1433 
1434 #if 1
1435  /*******************************************************************************
1436  * This is the configuration for the 16bit CRC Type:
1437  *******************************************************************************/
1438  crcCfg.channel = CRC_Channel_CH1;
1439  crcCfg.mode = CRC_Operational_Mode_FULL_CPU;
1440  crcCfg.type = CRC_Type_16BIT;
1441  crcCfg.bitSwap = CRC_BitSwap_MSB;
1442  crcCfg.byteSwap = CRC_ByteSwap_ENABLED;
1443  crcCfg.dataLen = CRC_DataLen_16_BIT;
1444 #endif
1445 #if 0
1446  /*******************************************************************************
1447  * This is the configuration for the 32bit CRC Type:
1448  *******************************************************************************/
1449  crcCfg.channel = CRC_Channel_CH1;
1450  crcCfg.mode = CRC_Operational_Mode_FULL_CPU;
1451  crcCfg.type = CRC_Type_32BIT;
1452  crcCfg.bitSwap = CRC_BitSwap_LSB;
1453  crcCfg.byteSwap = CRC_ByteSwap_DISABLED;
1454  crcCfg.dataLen = CRC_DataLen_32_BIT;
1455 #endif
1456 #if 0
1457  /*******************************************************************************
1458  * This is the configuration for the 64bit CRC Type:
1459  *******************************************************************************/
1460  crcCfg.channel = CRC_Channel_CH1;
1461  crcCfg.mode = CRC_Operational_Mode_FULL_CPU;
1462  crcCfg.type = CRC_Type_64BIT;
1463  crcCfg.bitSwap = CRC_BitSwap_MSB;
1464  crcCfg.byteSwap = CRC_ByteSwap_ENABLED;
1465  crcCfg.dataLen = CRC_DataLen_32_BIT;
1466 #endif
1467 
1468  /* Open the CRC Driver */
1469  gMmwaveLinkMCB.crcHandle = CRC_open (&crcCfg, &errCode);
1470  if (gMmwaveLinkMCB.crcHandle == NULL)
1471  {
1472  System_printf ("Error: Unable to open the CRC Channel [Error Code %d]\n", errCode);
1473  return -1;
1474  }
1475  System_printf("Debug: CRC Channel %p has been opened successfully\n", gMmwaveLinkMCB.crcHandle);
1476 
1477  /*****************************************************************************
1478  * Launch the Mmwave Link Tasks:
1479  *****************************************************************************/
1480 
1481  /* Initialize and Launch the mmWave Link Management Task: */
1482  Task_Params_init(&taskParams);
1483  taskParams.priority = 5;
1484  Task_create(MmwaveLink_mmwaveLinkMgmtTask, &taskParams, NULL);
1485 
1486  /*****************************************************************************
1487  * Initialize the mmWave Link: We need to have the link management task
1488  * operational to be able to process the SPAWN function.
1489  *****************************************************************************/
1490 
1491  /* Reset the client context: */
1492  memset ((void *)&RlApp_ClientCtx, 0, sizeof(rlClientCbs_t));
1493 
1494  RlApp_ClientCtx.ackTimeout = 1000U;
1495 
1496  /* Setup the crc Type in the mmWave link and synchronize this with the
1497  * created CRC Channel. */
1498  if (crcCfg.type == CRC_Type_16BIT)
1499  RlApp_ClientCtx.crcType = RL_CRC_TYPE_16BIT_CCITT;
1500  else if (crcCfg.type == CRC_Type_32BIT)
1501  RlApp_ClientCtx.crcType = RL_CRC_TYPE_32BIT;
1502  else
1503  RlApp_ClientCtx.crcType = RL_CRC_TYPE_64BIT_ISO;
1504 
1505  /* Setup the platform on which the mmWave Link executes */
1506  RlApp_ClientCtx.platform = platform;
1507  RlApp_ClientCtx.arDevType = deviceType;
1508 
1509  /* Initialize the Communication Interface API: */
1510  RlApp_ClientCtx.comIfCb.rlComIfOpen = MmwaveLink_mboxOpen;
1511  RlApp_ClientCtx.comIfCb.rlComIfClose = MmwaveLink_mboxClose;
1512  RlApp_ClientCtx.comIfCb.rlComIfRead = MmwaveLink_mboxRead;
1513  RlApp_ClientCtx.comIfCb.rlComIfWrite = MmwaveLink_mboxWrite;
1514 
1515  /* Initialize OSI Mutex Interface */
1516  RlApp_ClientCtx.osiCb.mutex.rlOsiMutexCreate = Osal_mutexCreate;
1517  RlApp_ClientCtx.osiCb.mutex.rlOsiMutexLock = Osal_mutexLock;
1518  RlApp_ClientCtx.osiCb.mutex.rlOsiMutexUnLock = Osal_mutexUnlock;
1519  RlApp_ClientCtx.osiCb.mutex.rlOsiMutexDelete = Osal_mutexDelete;
1520 
1521  /* Initialize OSI Semaphore Interface */
1522  RlApp_ClientCtx.osiCb.sem.rlOsiSemCreate = Osal_semCreate;
1523  RlApp_ClientCtx.osiCb.sem.rlOsiSemWait = Osal_semWait;
1524  RlApp_ClientCtx.osiCb.sem.rlOsiSemSignal = Osal_semSignal;
1525  RlApp_ClientCtx.osiCb.sem.rlOsiSemDelete = Osal_semDelete;
1526 
1527  /* Initialize OSI Queue Interface */
1528  RlApp_ClientCtx.osiCb.queue.rlOsiSpawn = MmwaveLink_spawn;
1529 
1530  /* Initialize OSI Timer Interface */
1531  RlApp_ClientCtx.timerCb.rlDelay = NULL;
1532 
1533  /* Initialize the CRC Interface */
1534  RlApp_ClientCtx.crcCb.rlComputeCRC = MmwaveLink_computeCRC;
1535 
1536  /* Initialize Device Control Interface */
1537  RlApp_ClientCtx.devCtrlCb.rlDeviceDisable = MmwaveLink_disableDevice;
1538  RlApp_ClientCtx.devCtrlCb.rlDeviceEnable = MmwaveLink_enableDevice;
1539  RlApp_ClientCtx.devCtrlCb.rlDeviceMaskHostIrq = MmwaveLink_maskHostIRQ;
1540  RlApp_ClientCtx.devCtrlCb.rlDeviceUnMaskHostIrq = MmwaveLink_unmaskHostIRQ;
1541  RlApp_ClientCtx.devCtrlCb.rlRegisterInterruptHandler = MmwaveLink_registerInterruptHandler;
1542 
1543  /* Initialize the Asynchronous Event Handler: */
1544  RlApp_ClientCtx.eventCb.rlAsyncEvent = MmwaveLink_asyncEventHandler;
1545 
1546  /* Power on the Device */
1547  if (rlDevicePowerOn(1U, RlApp_ClientCtx) != 0)
1548  {
1549  System_printf("Error: Power on request to the BSS failed\n");
1550  return -1;
1551  }
1552 
1553  /* Power off the Device */
1554  if(rlDevicePowerOff() != 0)
1555  {
1556  System_printf("Error: Power off request to the BSS failed\n");
1557  return -1;
1558  }
1559 
1560  /* Power on the Device again */
1561  if (rlDevicePowerOn(1U, RlApp_ClientCtx) != 0)
1562  {
1563  System_printf("Error: Second Power on request to the BSS failed\n");
1564  return -1;
1565  }
1566 
1567  return 0;
1568 }
1569

1629 int32_t MmwaveLink_rlSetLoopBackBurstCfg(uint8_t loopBackType)
1630 {

1633  if ((loopBackType >=1) && (loopBackType <= 3))
1634  {
1635  data.loopbackSel = loopBackType;
1636  }
1637  else
1638  {
1639  data.loopbackSel = 0;
1640  }
1641  data.baseProfileIndx = 0;
1642  data.burstIndx = 0;
1643  data.freqConst = 1435384036U;
1644  data.slopeConst = -2077;
1645  data.txBackoff = 0;
1646  data.rxGain = 30;
1647  data.txEn = 0;
1648  data.bpmConfig = 0;
1649  data.digCorrDis = 0;
1650  data.ifLbFreq = 0;
1651  data.ifLbMag = 10;
1652  data.ps1PgaIndx = 10;
1653  data.ps2PgaIndx = 10;
1654  data.psLbFreq = 0;
1655  data.paLbFreq =100;
1656 
1657  /* Set Loop Back burst configuration */
1658  retVal = rlSetLoopBckBurstCfg(RL_DEVICE_MAP_INTERNAL_BSS, &data);
1659  /* Check for mmWaveLink API call status */
1660  if(retVal != 0)
1661  {
1662  /* Error: Link reported an issue. */
1663  System_printf("Error: rlSetLoopBckBurstCfg retVal=%d\n", retVal);
1664  return -1;
1665  }
1666 
1667  return 0;
1668 }

1898 int32_t MmwaveLink_getProfileConfig (void)
1899 {
1900  int32_t retVal, i;
1901  rlProfileCfg_t getProfileData = { 0 };
1902 
1903  for(i = 0; i< gTestMiscCfg.numProfiles; i++)
1904  {
1905  /* Get profile configuration */
1906  retVal = rlGetProfileConfig(RL_DEVICE_MAP_INTERNAL_BSS, i, (rlProfileCfg_t*)&getProfileData);
1907 
1908  /* Check for mmWaveLink API call status */
1909  if(retVal != 0)
1910  {
1911  /* Error: Link reported an issue. */
1912  System_printf("Error: rlGetProfileConfig retVal=%d\n", retVal);
1913  return -1;
1914  }
1915  if((getProfileData.adcStartTimeConst != profileCfg[i].adcStartTimeConst) || \
1916  (getProfileData.digOutSampleRate != profileCfg[i].digOutSampleRate) || \
1917  (getProfileData.freqSlopeConst != profileCfg[i].freqSlopeConst) || \
1918  (getProfileData.hpfCornerFreq1 != profileCfg[i].hpfCornerFreq1) || \
1919  (getProfileData.hpfCornerFreq2 != profileCfg[i].hpfCornerFreq2) || \
1920  (getProfileData.idleTimeConst != profileCfg[i].idleTimeConst) || \
1921  (getProfileData.numAdcSamples != profileCfg[i].numAdcSamples) || \
1922  (getProfileData.profileId != profileCfg[i].profileId) || \
1923  (getProfileData.rampEndTime != profileCfg[i].rampEndTime) || \
1924  (getProfileData.rxGain != profileCfg[i].rxGain) || \
1925  (getProfileData.startFreqConst != profileCfg[i].startFreqConst) || \
1926  (getProfileData.txOutPowerBackoffCode != profileCfg[i].txOutPowerBackoffCode) || \
1927  (getProfileData.txPhaseShifter != profileCfg[i].txPhaseShifter) || \
1928  (getProfileData.txStartTime != profileCfg[i].txStartTime))
1929  {
1930  System_printf("Error: rlGetProfileConfig parameters not matched with configured parameters\n", retVal);
1931  retVal = -1;
1932  }
1933  }
1934 
1935  return 0;
1936 }

2005 rlChirpCfg_t getChirpCfg[DFPTEST_MAX_NUM_CHIRPCFG] = {0};
2017 int32_t MmwaveLink_getChirpConfig (uint16_t startIdx, uint16_t endIdx)
2018 {
2019  int32_t retVal;
2020 
2021  if(endIdx - startIdx + 1 > DFPTEST_MAX_NUM_CHIRPCFG)
2022  {
2023  System_printf("Error: MmwaveLink_getChirpConfig number of chirps=%d exceeds DFPTEST_MAX_NUM_CHIRPCFG\n", endIdx - startIdx + 1);
2024  return -1;
2025  }
2026 
2027  /* Get chirp configuration */
2028  retVal = rlGetChirpConfig(RL_DEVICE_MAP_INTERNAL_BSS, startIdx, endIdx, &getChirpCfg[0]);
2029  /* Check for mmWaveLink API call status */
2030  if(retVal != 0)
2031  {
2032  /* Error: Link reported an issue. */
2033  System_printf("Error: rlGetChirpConfig retVal=%d\n", retVal);
2034  return -1;
2035  }
2036 
2037  return 0;
2038 }

2054 int32_t MmwaveLink_getDynChirpConfig (void)
2055 {
2056  int32_t retVal, i = 0,j = 0;
2057  uint16_t startIdx;
2058 
2059  if (dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRowSelect == 0x00)
2060  {
2061  startIdx = dynChirpCfg[0].chirpSegSel*16;
2062  }
2063  else
2064  {
2065  startIdx = dynChirpCfg[0].chirpSegSel*48;
2066  }
2067 
2068  retVal = MmwaveLink_getChirpConfig(startIdx, startIdx + 9);
2069  /* Check for mmWaveLink API call status */
2070  if(retVal != 0)
2071  {
2072  /* Error: Link reported an issue. */
2073  System_printf("Error: rlGetChirpConfig retVal=%d\n", retVal);
2074  return -1;
2075  }
2076  /* compare each chirpConfig parameters to lastly configured via rlDynChirpConfig API */
2077  while (i <= 9)
2078  {
2079  if (dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRowSelect == 0x00)
2080  {
2081  if ((getChirpCfg[i].profileId != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR1, 4, 0)) || \
2082  (getChirpCfg[i].freqSlopeVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR1, 6, 8)) || \
2083  (getChirpCfg[i].txEnable != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR1, 3, 16)) || \
2084  (getChirpCfg[i].startFreqVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR2, 23, 0)) || \
2085  (getChirpCfg[i].idleTimeVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR3, 12, 0)) || \
2086  (getChirpCfg[i].adcStartTimeVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR3, 12, 16)))
2087  {
2088  break;
2089  }
2090  i++;
2091  }
2092  else if (dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRowSelect == 0x10)
2093  {
2094  if ((getChirpCfg[i].profileId != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR1, 4, 0)) || \
2095  (getChirpCfg[i].freqSlopeVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR1, 6, 8)) || \
2096  (getChirpCfg[i].txEnable != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR1, 3, 16)))
2097  {
2098  break;
2099  }
2100  i++;
2101  if ((getChirpCfg[i].profileId != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR2, 4, 0)) || \
2102  (getChirpCfg[i].freqSlopeVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR2, 6, 8)) || \
2103  (getChirpCfg[i].txEnable != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR2, 3, 16)))
2104  {
2105  break;
2106  }
2107  i++;
2108  if ((getChirpCfg[i].profileId != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR3, 4, 0)) || \
2109  (getChirpCfg[i].freqSlopeVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR3, 6, 8)) || \
2110  (getChirpCfg[i].txEnable != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR3, 3, 16)))
2111  {
2112  break;
2113  }
2114  i++;
2115  }
2116  else if (dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRowSelect == 0x20)
2117  {
2118  if (getChirpCfg[i].startFreqVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR1, 23, 0))
2119  {
2120  break;
2121  }
2122  i++;
2123  if (getChirpCfg[i].startFreqVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR2, 23, 0))
2124  {
2125  break;
2126  }
2127  i++;
2128  if (getChirpCfg[i].startFreqVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR3, 23, 0))
2129  {
2130  break;
2131  }
2132  i++;
2133  }
2134  else if (dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRowSelect == 0x30)
2135  {
2136  if ((getChirpCfg[i].idleTimeVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR1, 12, 0)) || \
2137  (getChirpCfg[i].adcStartTimeVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR1, 12, 16)))
2138  {
2139  break;
2140  }
2141  i++;
2142  if ((getChirpCfg[i].idleTimeVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR2, 12, 0)) || \
2143  (getChirpCfg[i].adcStartTimeVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR2, 12, 16)))
2144  {
2145  break;
2146  }
2147  i++;
2148  if ((getChirpCfg[i].idleTimeVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR3, 12, 0)) || \
2149  (getChirpCfg[i].adcStartTimeVar != GET_BIT_VALUE(dynChirpCfg[0].chirpRow[j].chirpNR3, 12, 16)))
2150  {
2151  break;
2152  }
2153  i++;
2154  }
2155  j++;
2156  }
2157  if (i <= 9)
2158  {
2159  retVal = -1;
2160  System_printf("Error: Parameters are mismatched GetChirpConfig compare to dynChirpConfig\n");
2161  }
2162  return 0;
2163 }
2164

2205 int32_t MmwaveLink_getFrameConfig (void)
2206 {
2207  int32_t retVal;
2208  rlFrameCfg_t frameData = { 0 };
2209  /* Get Frame configuration */
2210  retVal = rlGetFrameConfig(RL_DEVICE_MAP_INTERNAL_BSS, &frameData);
2211 
2212  /* Check for mmWaveLink API call status */
2213  if(retVal != 0)
2214  {
2215  /* Error: Link reported an issue. */
2216  System_printf("Error: rlGetFrameConfig retVal=%d\n", retVal);
2217  return -1;
2218  }
2219 
2220  if((frameData.chirpEndIdx != frameCfg.chirpEndIdx) || \
2221  (frameData.chirpStartIdx != frameCfg.chirpStartIdx) || \
2222  (frameData.framePeriodicity != frameCfg.framePeriodicity) || \
2223  (frameData.frameTriggerDelay != frameCfg.frameTriggerDelay) || \
2224  (frameData.numFrames != frameCfg.numFrames) || \
2225  (frameData.numLoops != frameCfg.numLoops) || \
2226  (frameData.triggerSelect != frameCfg.triggerSelect))
2227  {
2228  System_printf("Error: rlGetFrameConfig parameters not matched with configured parameters\n", retVal);
2229  retVal = -1;
2230  }
2231 
2232  return 0;
2233 }

2284 int32_t MmwaveLink_sensorStart (void)
2285 {
2286  int32_t retVal;
2287 
2288  /* Trigger the frame */
2289  retVal = rlSensorStart(RL_DEVICE_MAP_INTERNAL_BSS);
2290  if (retVal != 0)
2291  {
2292  System_printf ("Error: Unable to start Sensor [Error %d]\n", retVal);
2293  return -1;
2294  }
2295  /* if frame start async event is enable by rlRfSetDeviceCfg API,
2296  then wait for Frame start async event */
2297  if ((rfDevCfg.aeControl & 0x1) == 0x0)
2298  {
2299  while(gFrameStartStatus == 0U)
2300  {
2301  /* Sleep and poll again: */
2302  Task_sleep(1);
2303  }
2304  }
2305  return 0;
2306 }
2307 
2308 
2320 int32_t MmwaveLink_sensorStop (void)
2321 {
2322  int32_t retVal;
2323 
2324  /* Stop the frame */
2325  retVal = rlSensorStop(RL_DEVICE_MAP_INTERNAL_BSS);
2326  if (retVal != 0)
2327  {
2328  if(retVal == RL_RET_CODE_FRAME_ALREADY_ENDED)
2329  {
2330  System_printf ("Debug: Frames are already stopped [%d]\n", retVal);
2331  return 0;
2332  }
2333  System_printf ("Error: Unable to stop Sensor [Error %d]\n", retVal);
2334  return -1;
2335  }
2336 
2337  /* if frame stop async event is enable by rlRfSetDeviceCfg API,
2338  then wait for Frame stop async event */
2339  if ((rfDevCfg.aeControl & 0x2) == 0x0)
2340  {
2341  while(gFrameStartStatus == 1U)
2342  {
2343  /* Sleep and poll again: */
2344  Task_sleep(1);
2345  }
2346  }
2347  System_printf("Debug: Sensor stop successfully\n");
2348 
2349  return 0;
2350 }
2351

2824 int32_t mmwaveLink_getTemperatureReport(void)
2825 {
2826  int32_t retVal;
2827  rlRfTempData_t tempData = { 0 };
2828 
2829  /* Get Temerature report */
2830  retVal = rlRfGetTemperatureReport(RL_DEVICE_MAP_INTERNAL_BSS, (rlRfTempData_t*)&tempData);
2831 
2832  /* Check for mmWaveLink API call status */
2833  if(retVal != 0)
2834  {
2835  /* Error: Link reported an issue. */
2836  System_printf("Error: rlRfGetTemperatureReport retVal=%d\n", retVal);
2837  return -1;
2838  }
2839  /* Display the temperature readings */
2840  System_printf ("Debug : Temerature readings\n");
2841  System_printf ("RX0 : %3d degree C, RX1 : %3d degree C, RX2 : %3d degree C, RX3 : %3d degree C\n",
2842  tempData.tmpRx0Sens, tempData.tmpRx1Sens, tempData.tmpRx2Sens, tempData.tmpRx3Sens);
2843  System_printf ("TX0 : %3d degree C, TX1 : %3d degree C, TX2 : %3d degree C\n",
2844  tempData.tmpTx0Sens, tempData.tmpTx1Sens, tempData.tmpTx2Sens);
2845  System_printf ("PM : %3d degree C, DIG0: %3d degree C",
2846  tempData.tmpPmSens, tempData.tmpDig0Sens);
2847  if (gTestMiscCfg.dig1TempSensor == true)
2848  {
2849  System_printf (", DIG1: %3d degree C", tempData.tmpDig1Sens);
2850  }
2851  System_printf ("\n");
2852 
2853  return 0;
2854 }

2867 int32_t mmwaveLink_testSourceConfig(void)
2868 {
2869  int32_t retVal;
2870 
2871  /* Set Test source configuration */
2872  retVal = rlSetTestSourceConfig(RL_DEVICE_MAP_INTERNAL_BSS, (rlTestSource_t*)&testSourceCfg);
2873 
2874  /* Check for mmWaveLink API call status */
2875  if(retVal != 0)
2876  {
2877  /* Error: Link reported an issue. */
2878  System_printf("Error: rlSetTestSourceConfig retVal=%d\n", retVal);
2879  return -1;
2880  }
2881

3359 
3370 int32_t MmwaveLink_negativeTest (void)
3371 {
3372  int32_t retVal;
3373  rlFwVersionParam_t rfVersionData = { 0 };
3374 
3375  /* Negative test 1 : Corrupt Response checksum */
3376  retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptType = 1;
3377  retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptEvent = 1;
3378  retVal = rlDeviceGetRfVersion(RL_DEVICE_MAP_INTERNAL_BSS, &rfVersionData);
3379  if (retVal == -7)
3380  {
3381  /* If application receive checksum mismatch error execute command again to get correct data */
3382  retVal = rlDeviceGetRfVersion(RL_DEVICE_MAP_INTERNAL_BSS, &rfVersionData);
3383  }
3384  if(retVal != 0)
3385  {
3386  /* Error: Link reported an issue. */
3387  System_printf("Error: Response checksum corruption failed retVal=%d\n", retVal);
3388  return -1;
3389  }
3390 
3391  /* Negative test 2 : Corrupt async event checksum */
3392  retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptType = 1;
3393  retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptEvent = 2;
3394  /* Set GPADC configuration */
3395  retVal = rlSetGpAdcConfig(RL_DEVICE_MAP_INTERNAL_BSS, (rlGpAdcCfg_t*)&gpAdcCfg);
3396  /* Check for mmWaveLink API call status */
3397  if(retVal != 0)
3398  {
3399  /* Error: Link reported an issue. */
3400  System_printf("Error: rlSetGpAdcConfig retVal=%d\n", retVal);
3401  }
3402  /* Corrupting checksum for async event, wait for mmwaveLink checksum fail report */
3403  while(gMmwlChecksumFailAsyncEvent == 0U)
3404  {
3405  /* Sleep and poll again: */
3406  Task_sleep(1);
3407  }
3408  gMmwlChecksumFailAsyncEvent = 0U;
3409  if(retVal != 0)
3410  {
3411  /* Error: Link reported an issue. */
3412  System_printf("Error: Async-Event checksum corruption failed retVal=%d\n", retVal);
3413  return -1;
3414  }
3415 
3416  /* Negative test 3 : Corrupt async event CRC */
3417  retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptType = 2;
3418  retryNegativeTestCfg.corruptEvent = 2;
3419  /* Set GPADC configuration */
3420  retVal = rlSetGpAdcConfig(RL_DEVICE_MAP_INTERNAL_BSS, (rlGpAdcCfg_t*)&gpAdcCfg);
3421  /* Check for mmWaveLink API call status */
3422  if(retVal != 0)
3423  {
3424  /* Error: Link reported an issue. */
3425  System_printf("Error: rlSetGpAdcConfig retVal=%d\n", retVal);
3426  }
3427  /* Corrupting CRC for async event, wait for mmwaveLink CRC fail report */
3428  while(gMmwlCrcFailAsyncEvent == 0U)
3429  {
3430  /* Sleep and poll again: */
3431  Task_sleep(1);
3432  }
3433  gMmwlCrcFailAsyncEvent = 0U;
3434  if(retVal != 0)
3435  {
3436  /* Error: Link reported an issue. */
3437  System_printf("Error: Async-Event CRC corruption failed retVal=%d\n", retVal);
3438  return -1;
3439  }
3440  return 0;
3441 }
3442 
3456 int32_t MmwaveLink_adcBufConfig()
3457 {
3458  ADCBuf_dataFormat dataFormat;
3459  ADCBuf_RxChanConf rxChanConf;
3460  int32_t retVal;
3461  uint8_t numBytePerSample, numRxChannel = 0, channel;
3462  uint32_t bufSizePerChan;
3463  extern rlChanCfg_t chCfg;
3464  extern rlProfileCfg_t profileCfg[4];
3465  extern rlAdcOutCfg_t adcOutCfgArgs;
3466 
3467  /* Configure ADC buffer data format */
3468  if (adcOutCfgArgs.fmt.b2AdcOutFmt == ADC_FORMAT_REAL)
3469  {
3470  dataFormat.adcOutFormat = 1U; /* 0 - Complex Data mode, 1 - Real data mode */
3471  }
3472  else
3473  {
3474  dataFormat.adcOutFormat = 0U; /* 0 - Complex Data mode, 1 - Real data mode */
3475  }
3476  dataFormat.sampleInterleave = 0U;
3477  dataFormat.channelInterleave = 1U;
3478 
3479  retVal = ADCBuf_control(adcbufHandle, ADCBufMMWave_CMD_CONF_DATA_FORMAT, (void *)&dataFormat);
3480  if (retVal < 0)
3481  {
3482  System_printf("Error: ADCBufMMWave_CMD_CONF_DATA_FORMAT failed with [Error %d]\n", retVal);
3483  }
3484 
3485  /* Calculate the DMA transfer parameters */
3486  if (dataFormat.adcOutFormat == 0)
3487  {
3488  /* Complex dataFormat has 4 bytes */
3489  numBytePerSample = 4 ;
3490  }
3491  else
3492  {
3493  /* Real dataFormat has 2 bytes */
3494  numBytePerSample = 2 ;
3495  }
3496 
3497  /* Enable the receive channels */
3498  for (channel = 0; channel < SYS_COMMON_NUM_RX_CHANNEL; channel++)
3499  {
3500  /* Is the channel enabled? */
3501  if (chCfg.rxChannelEn & (0x1 << channel))
3502  {
3503  /* YES: Populate the receive channel configuration: */
3504  rxChanConf.channel = channel;
3505 
3506  /* Calculate ADCBuf size per channel */
3507  bufSizePerChan = profileCfg[0].numAdcSamples * numBytePerSample;
3508 
3509  /* Chirp Mode: */
3510  rxChanConf.offset = bufSizePerChan * numRxChannel;
3511 
3512  /* Offset is used in non-interleaved mode and it must be 16 bytes aligned. */
3513  if(rxChanConf.offset % 16)
3514  {
3515  // DebugP_assert(0);
3516  }
3517 
3518  /* Enable the channel: ADCBuf channel offset address is used for non-interleaved mode, the address must be 16 bytes aligned.*/
3519  retVal = ADCBuf_control(adcbufHandle, ADCBufMMWave_CMD_CHANNEL_ENABLE, (void *)&rxChanConf);
3520  if(retVal < 0)
3521  {
3522  System_printf("Error: ADCBufMMWave_CMD_CHANNEL_ENABLE failed for channel %d , offset = %x, with [Error %d]\n",
3523  channel, rxChanConf.offset, retVal);
3524  }
3525 
3526  /* Track the number of receive channels: */
3527  numRxChannel++;
3528  }
3529  }
3530 
3531  return 0;
3532 }
